greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number A(n,k) of tilings of a k X n rectangle using straight (3 X 1) trominoes and 2 X 2 tiles; square array A(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Antidiagonals n = 0..27, flattened
example: A(4,4) = 3, because there are 3 tilings of a 4 X 4 rectangle using straight (3 X 1) trominoes and 2 X 2 tiles:
maple: b:= proc(n, l) option remember; local k, t;
if max(l[])>n then 0 elif n=0 or l=[] then 1
elif min(l[])>0 then t:=min(l[]); b(n-t, map(h->h-t, l))
else for k do if l[k]=0 then break fi od;
`if`(k<nops(l) and l[k+1]=0, b(n, subsop(k=2, k+1=2, l)), 0)+
mathematica: b[n_, l_] := b[n, l] = Module[{ k, t}, If [Max[l] > n, 0, If[n == 0 || l == {}, 1, If[ Min[l] > 0 ,t = Min[l]; b[n-t, l-t], k = Position[l, 0, 1][[1, 1]]; b[n, ReplacePart[l, k -> 3]] + If[k < Length[l] && l[[k+1]] == 0, b[n, ReplacePart[l, {k -> 2, k+1 -> 2}]], 0] + If[k+1 < Length[l] && l[[k+1]] == 0 && l[[k+2]] == 0, b[n, ReplacePart[l, {k -> 1, k+1 -> 1, k+2 -> 1}]], 0] ] ] ] ]; a[n_, k_] := If[n >= k, b[n, Array[0&, k]], b[k, Array[0&, n]]]; Table[Table[a[n, d-n], {n, 0, d}], {d, 0, 14}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 16 2013, translated from Maple *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Dec 02 2012
